session.workspace
Class WorkspaceDriver

java.lang.Object
  session.workspace.WorkspaceDriver
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlockingWorkspaceDriver, BlockingWorkspaceDriver, BlockingWorkspaceDriver, DirectAssignmentWorkspace, NonBlockingWorkspaceDriver
public abstract class WorkspaceDriver
extends java.lang.Object

A workspace is a set of locations that do not share any memory space, a set of links connecting pairs of locations and a model of computation that drives its behavior. The model of computation specifies the timing characteristics of the computations involving the locations and the links of the workspace. Synchronization, global (virtual) time and global states are aspects related to the model of computation.

Each location of a workspace has its own Workspace Driver. These drivers distributedly implement the model of computation that governs the workspace. The methods of a Workspace Driver allow it to have control over the interactions between locations during a computation. First, every link, to be created, must be registered at the drivers of the locations that define the link. Second, when a method is invoked in a uses port by a component model, this invocation must be re-directed to the workspace driver of the location of the uses port that originated the invocation, which, in its turn, send it to the appropriate link.

A class that implements this interface must provide a constructor with two parameters: a String, for the name of the workspace, and a LocationDriver. This workspace is invoked by the addWorksapce method of the LocationDriver, by reflection.

Author:
Ricardo Corrï¿½a

registerLink

public boolean registerLink(java.lang.String linkName,
                            java.lang.String locationName)
Creates and registers a link, with a specified name, between this location and the specified location, which will belong to this workspace at the return of this method.

Parameters:
linkName - the link identification
locationName - the location joined to this one by the new link
Returns:
true if the link is correctly created.

invoke

public Datatype invoke(java.lang.String methodName,
                       Datatype[] args,
                       java.lang.String linkName)
Send a specified method invocation to another location in the workspace through a specified link. The method invocation returns no value.

Parameters:
methodName - name of the method being invoked portName.methodName
args - the arguments of the method invocation
linkName - the link that will transmit the invocation to other location
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no link associated with linkName

nonBlockingInvocation

public Datatype nonBlockingInvocation(java.lang.String methodName,
                                      Datatype[] args,
                                      java.lang.String linkName)
Send a specified method invocation to another location in the workspace through a specified link. The method invocation is sent in a non-blocking fashion, which means that the Datatype object r returned will only contain the result when r.getContents() != r.

Parameters:
methodName - name of the method being invoked portName.methodName
args - the arguments of the method invocation
linkName - the link that will transmit the invocation to other location
Returns:
the datatype returned by the method invoked
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no link associated with linkName

booleanInvocation

public boolean booleanInvocation(java.lang.String methodName,
                                 Datatype[] args,
                                 java.lang.String linkName)
Send a specified method invocation to another location in the workspace through a specified link. The method invoked must return a boolean value as a result. This invocation is blocking.

Parameters:
methodName - name of the method being invoked portName.methodName
args - the arguments of the method invocation
linkName - the link that will transmit the invocation to other location
Returns:
the datatype returned by the method invoked
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no link associated with linkName
